revised_title: Analysis of a Triple Sulphuret of Lead, Antimony, and Copper from Cornwall
tldr: Charles Hatchett analyzes a rare triple sulphuret ore from Cornwall, containing lead, antimony, and copper, and determines its composition and properties. The ore consists of the three metals in the metallic state, combined with sulfur. The analysis reveals that the proportions of the metals are approximately 17% sulfur, 24.23% antimony, 42.62% lead, 1.29% iron, and 12.8% copper.
